title.narrative: Provision of lifesaving and life-sustaining integrated nutrition response to IDPs and host communities in Kismayo lower juba region, Central South Somalia

description.narrative:
Southern aid proposal is in line with the SHF strategy number 2: Lifesaving and life-sustaining integrated response to IDPs and host communities however, proposed activities are in line with the 2016 Somalia Humanitarian Plan’s nutrition priorities of number 1: reduction of nutrition related morbidity and mortality rate to be below emergency threshold. To provide holistic life saving and life sustaining nutrition intervention Southern aid intends to scale up active community case finding, screening, admition and treatment of SAM cases boys and girl5 children in the targeted IDPs. Southern aid shall enhance referral services to the affective and most complicated cases to the nearest SC in Kismayo town to enable provide it adequate attention to the severely malnourished children in Kismayo IDPs. SA shall also provide routine immunization, deworming and vitamin A supplementation services to lt5 children boys and girls and also multiple micronutrient to the target beneficiaries. SA shall provide IMAM/IYCF and BSNP training packages to its technical nutrition staff as well as community health workers to enable them deliver effective management of the IMAM programs in the target IDPs in Kismayo.
